sentence: Among manual methods,  tries to achieve obfuscation by instructing humans to either imitate the writing style of some author or just try to hide their own writing style.
citation_titles: ['Adversarial stylometry: Circumventing authorship recognition to preserve privacy and anonymity']
citation_authors: [[Person('Brennan, Michael'), Person('Afroz, Sadia'), Person('Greenstadt, Rachel')]]

sentence: Among semi-automated methods,  presents a tool called Anonymouth which analyzes the input document using an authorship attribution method and then suggest text-based changes.
citation_titles: ['Use fewer instances of the letter “i”: Toward writing style anonymization']
citation_authors: [[Person('McDonald, Andrew WE'), Person('Afroz, Sadia'), Person('Caliskan, Aylin'), Person('Stolerman, Ariel'), Person('Greenstadt, Rachel')]]

sentence: In order to achieve obfuscation,  uses rule-based text transformations to push the style of input document towards the average style of corpus.
citation_titles: ['The case for being average: A mediocrity approach to style masking and author obfuscation']
citation_authors: [[Person('Karadzhov, Georgi'), Person('Mihaylova, Tsvetomila'), Person('Kiprov, Yasen'), Person('Georgiev, Georgi'), Person('Koychev, Ivan'), Person('Nakov, Preslav')]]

sentence: In search-based methods,  uses genetic algorithms (GA) along with an authorship attribution method to identify words in a document, changing which will have the maximum adverse effect on authorship attribution.
citation_titles: ['A Girl Has No Name: Automated Authorship Obfuscation using Mutant-X']
citation_authors: [[Person('Mahmood, Asad'), Person('Ahmad, Faizan'), Person('Shafiq, Zubair'), Person('Srinivasan, Padmini'), Person('Zaffar, Fareed')]]

sentence: tries to achieve obfuscation by increasing the stylistic distance between input document and author's existing text.
citation_titles: ['Heuristic Authorship Obfuscation']
citation_authors: [[Person('Bevendorff, Janek'), Person('Potthast, Martin'), Person('Hagen, Matthias'), Person('Stein, Benno')]]

sentence: Apart from these, there are also a couple of model-based approaches  which train a deep learning model to generate obfuscated documents.
citation_titles: ['A4NT: author attribute anonymity by adversarial training of neural machine translation', 'Style Obfuscation by Invariance']

sentence: uses stylometric features to perform obfuscation detection on manually obfuscated documents.
citation_titles: ['Detecting stylistic deception']
citation_authors: [[Person('Juola, Patrick')]]

sentence: also performs manual obfuscation detection using stylistic features.
citation_titles: ['Detecting hoaxes, frauds, and deception in writing style online']
citation_authors: [[Person('Afroz, Sadia'), Person('Brennan, Michael'), Person('Greenstadt, Rachel')]]

sentence: uses stylometric analysis to detect whether a document was generated using text spinners or not.
citation_titles: ['Accurate detection of automatically spun content via stylometric analysis']

sentence: helps humans in detecting whether a given piece of text is written by a human or a particular language model called GPT-2.
citation_titles: ['GLTR: Statistical Detection and Visualization of Generated Text']
citation_authors: [[Person('Gehrmann, Sebastian'), Person('Strobelt, Hendrik'), Person('Rush, Alexander')]]

sentence: They achieve this by extracting probability distribution of words given their context, using a pre-trained GPT-2  and then providing this information to humans.

sentence: Among semi-automated methods,  presents a tool called Anonymouth which analyzes the input document using an authorship attribution method and then suggest text-based changes.

citation_authors: [[Person('McDonald, Andrew WE'), Person('Afroz, Sadia'), Person('Caliskan, Aylin'), Person('Stolerman, Ariel'), Person('Greenstadt, Rachel')]]

sentence: In order to achieve obfuscation,  uses rule-based text transformations to push the style of input document towards the average style of corpus.

sentence: In search-based methods,  uses genetic algorithms (GA) along with an authorship attribution method to identify words in a document, changing which will have the maximum adverse effect on authorship attribution.

sentence: tries to achieve obfuscation by increasing the stylistic distance between input document and author's existing text.
